detaileddescription.para: This method is declared automatically by the GYOTO_OBJECT macro and defined automatically by the GYOTO_PROPERTY_END macro.
The default implementation calls double gmunu(const double * x, int mu, int nu) const.

output: second vector in the screen plane
output: vector normal to the screen

briefdescription.para: M * G / c^2, M is in kg, unitLength in meters.

detaileddescription.para: Metrics implementations are free to express lengths and distances in whatever unit they see fit (presumably most often geometrical units). This function returns this unit in SI (meters).
Returns the marginally bound radius Should be implemented in derived classes if useful If called on the base class, returns an error
Returns the marginally stable (ISCO) radius Should be implemented in derived classes if useful If called on the base class, returns an error
Returns the specific angular momentum l=-u_phi/u_t Should be implemented in derived classes if useful If called on the base class, returns an error
Returns potential W=-ln(|u_t|) for a cst specific angular momentum l_cst Should be implemented in derived classes if useful If called on the base class, returns an error
Get delta_min_
Set delta_min_
Get delta_max_
Get delta max at a given position

simplesect.para: the smallest value between delta_max_, delta_max_external, and R*delta_max_over_r_ where R is pos[1] in spherical coordinates and max(x1, x2, x3) in Cartesian coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: Set delta_max_

briefdescription.para: Compute xprime, yprime and zprime from 8-coordinates.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double coord[4], const double v[3]) const
memberdef.name: SysPrimeToTdot

briefdescription.para: Compute tdot as a function of dr/dt, dtheta/dt and dphi/dt. Everything is in geometrical units.

memberdef.argsstring: (double const pos[4], double vel[4], double dir=1.) const
memberdef.name: circularVelocity

briefdescription.para: Yield circular velocity at a given position.

detaileddescription.para: Give the velocity of a massive particle in circular orbit at the given position projected onto the equatorial plane. Such a velocity may not exist everywhere (or anywhere) for a given metric. This method is intended to be used by Astrobj classes such as Torus or ThinDisk.
If keplerian_ is set to true, this method should return the Keplerian velcity instead (derived classes should ensure this, see KerrBL::circularVelocity() for instance).
The default implementation throws an error if keplerian_ is set to false.

briefdescription.para: Yield ZAMO velocity at a given position.

detaileddescription.para: Give the velocity of a zero angular momentul observer (whatever is closest to "at rest"). The default implementation simply projects (1, 0, 0, 0) othogonally along ephi and normalizes it, thus ensuring that vel is orthogonal to ephi.

briefdescription.para: Set tdot (coord[4]) such that coord is light-like. Everything is in geometrical units.

detaileddescription.para: Set coord[4] so that the 4-velocity coord[4:7] is lightlike, i.e. of norm 0. There may be up to two solutions. coord[4] is set to the hightest. The lowest can be retrieved using nullifyCoord(double coord[8], double& tdot2) const. Everything is expressed in geometrical units.

parameterdescription.para: 8-position, coord[4] will be set according to the other elements;

briefdescription.para: Set tdot (coord[4]) such that coord is light-like and return other possible tdot.

detaileddescription.para: Set coord[4] so that the 4-velocity coord[4:7] is lightlike, i.e. of norm 0. There may be up to two solutions. coord[4] is set to the hightest. The lowest can be retrieved in tdot2. Everything is expressed in geometrical units.

parameterdescription.para: 8-position, coord[4] will be set according to the other elements;
will be set to the smallest solution

detaileddescription.para: First computes threevel as xiprime=xidot/x0dot for i in {1, 2, 3}, then computes x0dot using SyPrimeToTdot, then computes again xidot as xidot=xiprime*x0dot.

parameterdescription.para: 8-position, coord[4-7] will be set according to the other elements;

detaileddescription.para: First computes threevel as xiprime=xidot/x0dot for i in {1, 2, 3}, then computes x0dot using SyPrimeToTdot, then computes again xidot as xidot=xiprime*x0dot.

detaileddescription.para: The integrating loop will ask this the Metric through this method whether or not it is happy to continue the integration. Typically, the Metric should answer 0 when everything is fine, 1 when too close to the event horizon, inside the BH...

briefdescription.para: F function such as dx/dt=F(x,cst) for 3+1 case.
Set Metric-specific constants of motion. Used e.g. in KerrBL.
Increment the reference counter. Warning: Don't mess with the counter.
Decrement the reference counter and return current value. Warning: Don't mess with the counter.

detaileddescription.para: Return True if this object is thread-safe, i.e. if an instance and its clone can be used in parallel threads (in the context of Scenery::raytrace()). Known objects which are not thread-safe include Lorene metrics and everything from the Python plug-in.

The default implementation considers that the class itself is thread safe and recurses into the declared properties to check whether they are safe too. Classes that abide to the Object/Property paradigm and are themselves thread-safe have nothing special to do.
Objects that clone children in their copy constructor that are not declared as properties must take these children into account.
Classes that are never thread-safe must declare it. It acn be easily done using GYOTO_OBJECT_THREAD_SAFETY in the class declaration and GYOTO_PROPERTY_THREAD_UNSAFE in the class definition.

briefdescription.para: Set Value (expressed in unit) of a Property.
Set Value (expressed in unit) of a Property.
Get Value of a Property, converted to unit.
Get Value of a Property, converted to unit.

detaileddescription.para: Look into the Property list for a Property whose name (or name_false, for a boolean Property) is pname. Return a const pointer to the first such property found, or NULL if none is found.

briefdescription.para: Output a single Property to XML.

detaileddescription.para: The base implementation decides what to do based on the p.type. The format matches how setParameters() an setParameter() would interpret the XML descition.

Overriding this method should be avoided, but makes sense in some cases (for instance Screen::fillProperty() selects a different unit for Distance based on its magnitude, so that stellar sizes are expressed in solar radii while smaller sizes can be expressed in meters and larger sizes in parsecs).

briefdescription.para: Fill the XML element for this Object.

detaileddescription.para: The base implementation simply calls fillProperty() for each Property defined for the Object.
Derived classes should avoid overriding fillElement(). It may make sense occasionally, e.g. to make sure that the metric is output first.
To customize how a given Property is rendered, it is better to override fillProperty().
If this method is overridden, the implementation should in general call fillElement() on the direct base.

briefdescription.para: Main loop for parsing Properties from XML description.

para.verbatim:
This function queries the FactoryMessenger for elements to parse, and tries to matche each element to a Property to set it accordingly.
Any class that tries to be buildable from XML must supply a subcontractor (for base classes such as Metric, Astrobj, Spectrum and Spectrometer, it is done as a template that must be specialized for each class).
This subcontractor typically looks somewhat like this:

Although this is discouraged, it is possible to override the following functions to customize how XML entities are parsed: - setParameters() if low-level access to the FactoryMessenger is required; - setParameter(std::string name, std::string content, std::string unit) to interpret an entity that does not match a Property (e.g. alternative name); - setParameter(Gyoto::Property const &p, std::string const &name, std::string const &content, std::string const &unit) to change how a Property is interpreted.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used when parsing an XML description, if no Property of this name is found. Overriding implementation should fall-back on calling the direct's parent implementation:

parameterdescription.para: XML name of the parameter (XML entity). This may have a path component, e.g. "Astrobj::Radius", in which case a property named "Astrobj" will be sought in the current object, and setParameter will be called recusrively on this Astrobj with Radius as name.

simplesect.para: 0 if this parameter is known, 1 if it is not.

memberdef.argsstring: (Gyoto::Property const &p, std::string const &name, std::string const &content, std::string const &unit)
memberdef.name: setParameter

detaileddescription.para: This function is used when parsing an XML description, if Property (p) of this name is found (i.e. either p.name or p.name_false is equal to name). Implementation should fall-back on calling the direct's parent implementation:

parameterdescription.para: Property that matches name (p.name == name or p.name_false == name)
XML name of the parameter (XML entity)

detaileddescription.para: Returns a string containing the name(s) and type of the property, as well as whether it supports unit.

briefdescription.para: Print (to stdout) some help on this class.

detaileddescription.para: Describe all properties that this instance supports.
Use from a Hook::Listener object method: teller->hook(this) where "this" is a Listener and "teller" is a Teller.
Use unhook() later to stop listening to a given Teller.
Use from a Hook::Listener object method: teller->unhook(this)
where "this" is a Listener, "teller" is a Teller, and "this" has called teller->hook(this) previously.

briefdescription.para: Whether some virtual methods are implemented.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementations of some methods call one-another. This member is used internally to avoid infinite recursion.
When compiled with libpthread

briefdescription.para: Minimum integration step for the adaptive integrator.
Maximum integration step for the adaptive integrator.

detaileddescription.para: Ensure that delta (the numerical integration step) is never larger than a fraction of the distance between the current location and the center of the coordinate system.

For investigations close to the event horizon, 0.5 is usually fine. If high accuracy is needed long after deflection (weak lensing), then this must be smaller. A good test is to look at a MinDistance map for a FixedStar: it must be smooth.

briefdescription.para: 1 if circularVelocity should return the Newtonian Keplerian velocity, in r^-3/2
The "kind" that is output in the XML entity.

detaileddescription.para: E.g. for an Astrobj, fillElement() will ensure <Astrobjkind="kind_"...>...</Astrobj> is written.

briefdescription.para: The plug-ins that needs to be loaded to access this instance's class.

detaileddescription.para: E.g. for an Astrobj, fillElement() will ensure <Astrobj...plugin="plugins_">...</Astrobj> is written.
coordkind(int coordkind) is protected because, for most Metrics, it should not be changed in runtime. Set coordinate kind
kind(const std::string) is protected because, for most Objects, it should not be changed in runtime. Set kind_

briefdescription.para: Call tell() on each hooked Listener.

detaileddescription.para: Whenever a Teller mutates, it should warn any Listener hooked to it using tellListeners().

briefdescription.para: A subcontractor builds an object upon order from the Factory.

detaileddescription.para: Various classes need to provide a subcontractor to be able to instantiate themselves upon order from the Factory. A subcontractor is a function (often a static member function) which accepts a pointer to a FactoryMessenger as unique parameter, communicates with the Factory using this messenger to read an XML description of the object to build, and returns this objet. SmartPointee::Subcontractor_t* is just generic enough a typedef to cast to and from other subcontractor types: Astrobj::Subcontractor_t, Metric::Subcontractor_t, Spectrum::Subcontractor_t. A subcontractor needs to be registered using the relevant Register() function: Astrobj::Register(), Metric::Register(), Spectrum::Register().
Use <Cartesian> or </Spherical> to select the coordinate system kind.
